groups.name: Alcohols
groups.description: Alcohols in haircare products are used to help products dry quickly, preserve formulations, and enhance ingredient absorption into hair

groups.name: Preservatives
groups.description: Preservatives in hair products can help prevent the growth of bacteria and mold

groups.name: Surfactants
groups.description: surfactants in hair products can help remove dirt and oil from the hair and scalp

groups.name: Silicones
groups.description: Synthetic ingredients that create a protective barrier on the hair, reducing friction and adding shine

references.notes: varies, discusses the different water solubilities of different silicones

groups.name: Waxes
groups.description: Waxes in styling products can add texture, hold, and shine to hair

references.notes: cites a study that hasn't be translated into into English that linked pomade to fungal growth

groups.name: Oils
groups.description: Oils in hair products can moisturize and add shine to hair

groups.name: Humectants
groups.description: Humectants are ingredients that attract moisture to the hair

references.notes: Humectants grab water out of air, but if air doesn't have enough water (dry weather), it can become brittle and create friction, which can mean frizz. Theoretically this could dehydrate hair. Oils can slow water loss. Notes that glycerin can be paired with emollients and film-formers to slow water loss. Caveats that none of this is well studied.

Defines film forming humectants as complex molecules that lose water more slowly because they have more 'nooks and crannies' for the water to hang out in. Also notes that hydrolyzed proteins can be film forming humectants. Smaller proteins can get under the cuticle and 'moisturize' from the inside. Medium/large proteins can form films. Pairing with oils can also help slow water loss.
Mentions Panthenol can increase hair's volume
Defines humectants as ingredient that grabs onto water slowing it from evaporating. Usually has OH and NH groups, as well as polarity, so can bond with water. Also needs to resist evaporation itself.
Defines humectants as ingredients that can hold large amounts of water and attract it from the atmosphere, but in dry conditions may pull water from your skin/hair
